sentence: The Home Depot Inc.HD kick-started fiscal 2015 with better-than-expected first-quarter results that benefited from a favorable spring season across most parts of the country and continued recovery in the U.S. housing market.
The company posted first-quarter fiscal 2015 adjusted earnings of $1.16 per share, which increased 16% from the year-ago quarter and surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.15.
Including one-time items, quarterly earnings surged 21% year over year to $1.21 per share.
Net sales advanced 6.1% to $20,891 million from $19,687 million in the year-ago quarter, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $20,775 million.
The company's overall comparable-store sales (comps) increased 6.1% while comps in the U.S. stores grew 7.1%.
Gross profit in the quarter improved 6.2% to $7,179 million from $6,757 million in the comparable year-ago quarter, primarily driven by higher sales.
Gross profit margin expanded 10 basis points (bps) to 34.4%.
Improved gross margin led operating income to soar 14.1% to $2,597 million during the quarter.
Further, operating margin expanded 80 bps to 12.4% from 11.6% in the year-ago quarter.

Home Depot ended first-quarter fiscal 2015 with cash and cash equivalents of $2,827 million, long-term debt (excluding current maturities) of $13,818 million and shareholders' equity of $9,204 million.
Also, during the first quarter, the company generated $3,404 million of net cash from operations.
Following the solid first-quarter results, Home Depot raised its outlook for fiscal 2015.
The company now projects sales growth of 4.2%-4.8% compared with 3.5%-4.7% expected earlier.
Comps growth is anticipated in the range of 4.0%-4.6% compared with the previous forecast of 3.3%-4.5%.
Consequently, Home Depot now envisions diluted earnings per share to grow in the range of 11%-12% in fiscal 2015, with earnings expected in the band of $5.24-$5.27 per share.
Earlier, the company had projected earnings per share growth of 8.5%-10% and earnings of $5.11-$5.17 per share.

Other Stocks That Warrant a Look

Currently, Home Depot carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Better-ranked stocks in the retail sector include American Eagle Outfitters Inc. AEO , L Brands Inc. LB and Aeropostale Inc. ARO , each carrying a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
